clinical_study.brief_title: Can Warm Skin Disinfection Reduce the Pain Peripheral Central Catheter Application in Premature Babies?
clinical_study.official_title: Does Warm Skin Disinfection Reduce the Pain Score or Increase the Application Success in Peripheral Central Catheter Application in Premature Babies?

lead_sponsor.agency: Zekai Tahir Burak Women's Health Research and Education Hospital

clinical_study.source: Zekai Tahir Burak Women's Health Research and Education Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Peripheral central catheter application, especially in extremely low birth weight premature babies, is an intensive care follow-up procedure. There are many clinical studies in areas such as catheter type, skin disinfection, catheter duration, catheter infection. In our practice, it was observed that premature baby was less uncomfortable, the number of trials decreased, and the change in body temperature was less with the application of hot skin disinfection in our practice. With a prospective randomized study, the investigators wanted to document their observational data scientifically.

detailed_description.textblock: Babies under 32 gestation week and 1250 g who are treated at level 3 NICU and need peripheral central catheter will be included in the study. In the preparation of peripheral central catheter application, skin cleaning is performed with povidone iodine in our clinic. The investigators used during the povidione iodine preparation phase after heating the bain-marie method with sterile conditions. The investigators predicted that the premature baby would have less discomfort with warm povidion iodine. To demonstrate this, it was planned to take both video recordings during the application and N-PASS evaluation by an experienced person who does not know the povidone iodine temperature used .In preparation of the catheter except the person who did povidone iodine skin cleansing, nobody knows the heat. The catheters were administered by a single experienced person. The study was designed to be unaware of the povidin iodine application temperature of the person applying the catheter and the N-PASS assessment.

primary_outcome.measure: change feeling of pain and restlessness in premature
primary_outcome.time_frame: every 10 seconds before the 5 minutes and during the procedure
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of pain score in the patient during the procedure with n-pass evaluation

secondary_outcome.description: body temperature monitoring before and during the incubator with skin temperature probe

arm_group.description: Povidion iodine will be used as a skin cleanser. povidion iodine will be heated sterile to 38 degrees with a ben-mari method and its temperature will be controlled by degrees. When it reaches the appropriate degree, the skin cleaning of the baby will be done sterile.
Povidion iodine will be used as a skin cleanser. povidion iodine will be used in the skin cleaning of the baby without any heating procedure.
